title: More effective logic is needed for processing disk sorting when there is a border value for the row count
OB: When sorting on disk, if the data set contains 40000 rows and the program is configured to process less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed by DtE: 1.
EB: When sorting on disk, if the data set contains 40000 rows and the program is configured to process less than 40000 rows, the expected behavior is that DtE should perform the following operations: 1. Save the data to a temporary file. 2. Load the data from the temporary file into memory. 3. Sort the data. 4. Save the sorted data to the temporary file. 5.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Set up a data set with 40000 rows. 2. Configure the program to process less than 40000 rows. 3. Trigger the sorting operation on disk. Observe the steps performed by DtE as mentioned in the observed behavior section.
